July 10, 2016

Why an Online Presence Matters for Your Brick & Mortar Store

Even if you aren’t ready to take the jump into making your brick and mortar store an e-commerce shopping experience, the success of your physical location depends, in part, on your ability to create a seamless customer experience both online and off.

In many ways, customers don’t see any difference between your online presence and your physical store location. They expect the same level of customer service, the same brand voice, and the same feeling they get from an in-store shopping experience with you.

So what are the benefits of having an online presence, and how can you optimize yours to increase sales and drive customer loyalty?

Ease of Access For Your Customer

When you want to know more about something, where’s the first place you look? If you answered, “the internet,” you’re not alone. Today, the web is the front-line for all types of research, from what types of window drapes to hang to where to purchase antique pottery in New England.

When you invest in an online presence for your store, you can answer those questions for your potential customers, all while positioning your shop as a useful resource and showing off your wares. Of course you want to be the store that shoppers visit when they’re on the hunt new items. But you also want to be the place shoppers can turn when they want to learn more.

With a strong online presence, you can help create experiences your customers enjoy both in-store and on the web. Position yourself as the subject matter expert with a regularly updated blog and social media channels. Use fantastic imagery and messaging to create interest in items that are available to buy immediately. Then, give users a reason to buy from you by sharing your expertise and your passion. We promise your customers will appreciate it.

Be Known For Great Customer Service

Just because you don’t have an e-commerce store, doesn’t mean you can’t make online shopping easy. A great website lets you take advantage of your customers’ browsing time when and where they have it.

You can also use basic technology to take it to the next level. Consider using Facebook Live to give a real-time tour of a new product line. Or look into providing “in store pickup” for customers who are short on time. Get creative to let your customers know how easy and enjoyable you will make their shopping experience.

Let Your Customers Be Your Marketing Team (at No Cost to You!)

Take advantage of your existing marketing assets (money already spent) and get online. Whether they’re Instagramming a great new product they love, “checking-in” to your physical location, or providing a referral via another online channel, satisfied customers can be the most successful sales team you’ll ever have behind you.

So make it easy for them to shout your name and tell others about your awesome business. Let them know where to find you online. Show them what hashtags to use, then incentivize their online engagement with social media contests. Create a community around your brand. You might be surprised to discover how many of your customers want to participate.

Control Your Reputation

Whether you like it or not, your business is already online. You’re featured in directory listings, reviewed on Yelp, and mentioned on social media. If you’re not the one controlling those messages, you open yourself up to the potential for a lot of misinformation about your business.

These websites are often used by customers to find businesses, so take advantage of this great marketing opportunity by claiming your listings and social profiles. It’s an integral (and easy) way to keep your business visible in search and to give new customers the ability to find you.

Ask Us Anything

Well, almost anything. Just tell us what you want to know, and we’ll be in touch with answers to your most pressing questions.

Ask Away!
